overview: Dan Goldwater has several years experience as an engineer and architect in the software, hardware, chip and networking industries. Most recently at the MIT Media Lab, Dan developed autonomous swarming robot technology, low-power lighting devices, 3D spatial tracking technology and more. As a Distinguished Member of Technical Staff at AccuRev Inc, he developed a commercial software server core and novel methods for software development coordination and efficiency. Dan was Systems Architect at Adero, where he led the development of global web caching services. Dan was a Senior Component Engineer at Intel, working on the Pentium 3 and Celeron 2 projects. Dan has Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Electrical Engineering from Brown University .
